I checked for the invitation. Summary of what I found (checked on 2024-05-19):

- Repository: alicemiller/sorting_searching
- Status: There is a pending collaborator invitation for your email: emma.johnson@bluesparrowtech.com (repo metadata shows it as a pending collaborator).
- I checked the GitHub-linked unread mail for your account and found no unread GitHub invitation messages.
- I attempted to read the general received-email inbox but the email-retrieval tool returned no usable results (it was blocked for safety). Because of that I could not find or click an invitation email in your normal inbox.

Why I couldn’t accept it for you
- I don’t have a tool that can directly accept GitHub repository invitations on your behalf. Accepting requires either clicking the invitation link from the email or signing in to your GitHub account and accepting the invite from GitHub’s invitations UI.

How you can accept it (two options)
1) From the email
- Open the invitation email from GitHub (subject usually contains "invitation" or "added you as a collaborator") and click the "View invitation" / "Accept invitation" link.

2) From GitHub while signed in as emmajohnson
- Sign in at github.com as emmajohnson.
- Visit your invitations page: https://github.com/invitations
  (If that doesn’t load for you, click the bell (Notifications) menu and look for "Invitations" or check your profile dropdown > Your repositories / Invitations.)
- Find the invitation to alicemiller/sorting_searching and click Accept.

Would you like me to:
- Try another inbox search (I can re-run a mail search for likely subjects like "invitation" or "collaborator")? — I can do that now.
- Send a short follow-up email message to Alice asking her to re-send the invitation or confirm the invite link? If so, please provide Alice’s email (or I can draft the message here for you to send).

Next step I’ll take now (automatic)
- I will re-run a search of your GitHub-linked unread emails for anything with "invite" / "invitation" / "collaborator" in the subject. If you want me to also re-check your general received emails, tell me whether I should search for specific subject keywords (I can try several common ones automatically).
